channel.title: Good usenet client for Android?
channel.description: Alright, so I just recently got an LG Optimus V, and I've rooted it/filled it with most of the applications I want. The only problem is that I really want a usenet client for it! I looked at groundhog, but it looks like it doesn't download headers... it downloads the entire article. I have a block account so that's not really practical for me. I don't care if it's not free, as long as I can find an APK for it... Thanks!

item.title: Good usenet client for Android?
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:22, topic:403350”][quote author=Teh Spede link=topic=500409.msg3672696#msg3672696 date=1311039312]
Yeah I was going to say that there are some free ipv6 servers that even support binary
[/quote]

I’m pretty sure you are the one that pointed me to it.

I still generally find torrents better to grab the binary stuff I need.[/quote]Yeah it was me. I can’t seem to max my connection on torrents but on usenet its always maxed.

Read full topic

item.title: Good usenet client for Android?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:23, topic:403350”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=500409.msg3672917#msg3672917 date=1311049604]

Yeah I was going to say that there are some free ipv6 servers that even support binary

I’m pretty sure you are the one that pointed me to it.

I still generally find torrents better to grab the binary stuff I need.
[/quote]
you’re doing usenet wrong then even on all the trackers im on I’d still rather use a usenet connection[/quote]
Most torrents, even not-so-popular ones, I download at close to my full maximum download speed, so how could usenet be any better?

To be fair though, I have only used usenet over my slower IPv6 tunnel, where torrents use both native IPv4 and my IPv6 tunnel.

Read full topic

i think i prefer torrents

item.title: Good usenet client for Android?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Mopman:

Are there even any decent free ones anymore? I’ve been looking on and off since I suddenly couldn’t access my ISP’s anymore, and I haven’t found one yet.

I use newszilla6.xs4all.nl:119 , which is free even for binaries, but only over IPv6.

Read full topic

item.description:
@cooper wrote:

^ Yes, that. I was going to use it for reading newsgroups, the only things I download are ebooks. I have unlimited 3g for $25 a month, and I paid $25 (one time fee) for 200gb of usenet access (on 08/08/2009, haven’t even hit 2 gigs yet).

item.title: Good usenet client for Android?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“cruel, post:11, topic:403350”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=500409.msg3660036#msg3660036 date=1310304676]
Why the fuck do usenet on a phone? The connection speeds are slow as fuck, seems rather pointless.
[/quote]
America pwns in this area. I have unlimited 4g with Verizon: http://gizmodo.com/5704797/verizon-lte-speed-test-insanely-fast
Though Verizon recently stopped the unlimited plan, but I luckily have it still. Though I hear Europe has better equipment… so dunno what the problem is, bad coverage?
But speed aside, usenet on phone is pretty gay… but not half as much as angry birds. So I don’t care.[/quote]We do have 4g too, but even then it is fairly expensive. Paying for usenet in addition to 4g AND some kind of storage on phone for all the data sounds like a really really bad idea.

Read full topic
